intro: Lepanthes microprosartima, commonly known as the small-lobed slipper orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family and is native to Central America. This epiphytic plant typically grows on trees in humid, shaded environments. It features small, delicate flowers with a distinctive slipper-shaped pouch, which is a characteristic trait of the genus Lepanthes. The plant's leaves are usually dark green and革质 (leathery), aiding in water retention. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
